subject: Guidelines for site insepction of projects by ROs and PDs using PMIS App and uploading the site photographs
text: HRav <zfy T@THNf qifearrut 844_ Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 FI (Wsm @ar aik {TmHTf 4A<T4) 477 Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 Ht National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 0f-5 & 6, dazr-10 , ERa, 7 ferit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAIIPolicy Guidelines/ Guidelines for site inspection of projects using PMIS App. and uploading the site photographs /2017 No. 6.19/2017, Dated the 16th November, 2017 (Decision taken on File No_NHAI/ PMS /Project Monitoring /2017 Sub: Guidelines for site inspection of projects using PMIS App. and uploading the site photographs NHAI is   developing  infrastructure across the country by constructing 4/6 National Highways under various modes such as BOT/EPC/PPP /Hybrid Annuity and Bharat Mala etc. But the targeted progress is not being achieved due to lack of supervision and inspection by the field units. Therefore, it has been desired by Chairman, NHAI that following guidelines may be followed for site inspection using PMIS App for effective monitoring of construction activities at site and site photographs may be uploaded: (A Periodicity of site inspection: (i) The PDs should visit every project site at least once in 15 days. (ii) The ROs at least once in 30 days: (iii) The Member at their discretion as per need of the project; (B) Guidelines for use of PMIS App: (i) Once ROIPD reach the project site, they should check in using the PMIS ApP; which will register their location along with latitude/longitude of the place and time of check in. (ii) The site visiting officers should upload at least three latest site photographs. (iii) The site visiting officer can interact with the concerned technical divisions and seek clarifications using the PMIS (iv) All the inputs, communications and photographs will be stored on the PMIS database against the respective project for record purposes 2 This issues with the approval of Competent Authority. (A.K; Sadhu) Chief General Manager (Coordination) To All Officers and Employees of HQ/ ROs/ PIUs/ CMUs/ Site Offices. Hindi Officer for translation in Hindi. R M INHAL Reg: App:
